dataset_info.name: India Disaster Management Chatbot Dataset
dataset_info.source: National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), Government of India

national_numbers.description: Single emergency helpline for Police, Ambulance, and Fire services. Works 24/7 across all states/UTs. Can be accessed via phone call, SMS, email, panic button, and 112 India mobile app.
National Disaster Response Force for earthquakes, floods, and major disasters

before.details: Include first aid supplies, emergency food and water (for at least 3 days), flashlight, battery-powered radio, extra batteries, important documents in waterproof container

before.step: Practice DROP, COVER, and HOLD ON drills
before.details: Drop to ground, take cover under sturdy furniture, and hold on until shaking stops

during.step: If indoors: DROP, COVER, HOLD ON
during.details: Drop to ground immediately, take cover under sturdy furniture, hold on and protect your head and neck. Stay under cover until shaking stops
Avoid windows, glass, mirrors, hanging objects, exterior walls, and anything that could fall

after.details: Provide first aid as needed. Do not move seriously injured persons unless in immediate danger
Drop, Cover, Hold On during aftershocks. Aftershocks can cause additional damage

before.details: Monitor weather forecasts, flood warnings from IMD and CWC. Know if you're in flood-prone area
Identify safe routes to higher ground, know location of emergency shelters

during.details: Follow evacuation orders from authorities without delay
6 inches of moving water can knock you down. If must walk, use stick to check depth

after.details: Wait for authorities to declare area safe before returning
Use only bottled, boiled, or treated water until supply declared safe

before.details: Monitor weather forecasts, understand warning colors (Yellow, Orange, Red)
Board up windows, secure loose outdoor items, trim trees close to home

during.details: Remain inside strong building away from windows
Do not go outside during calm period - violent winds will resume

after.details: Stay inside until authorities announce it's safe
Stay away from damaged buildings and power lines

before.details: Place on every level of home, test monthly, change batteries annually
Know two ways out of every room, practice fire drills regularly

during.details: Use stairs, never elevator. Crawl low under smoke

after.details: Wait for fire department to declare building safe
Take photos for insurance before cleanup

during.details: Drink water frequently even if not thirsty. Use ORS, lassi, lemon water
Stay indoors during peak hours (12 PM - 3 PM)
High fever (>104Â°F), confusion, loss of consciousness - CALL 102/108 IMMEDIATELY

basic_first_aid.disclaimer: This is basic information only. Always call 102/108 for medical emergencies. If in doubt, seek professional medical help immediately.

steps: Apply direct pressure with clean cloth
Elevate injured area above heart if possible
If bleeding doesn't stop in 10 minutes or is severe, call 102/108
Cool with water, ice packs on neck, armpits, groin
